lines.text: Hecate, Queen of Darkness, revenge yourself against the Thessalians. Deliver to me the children of the hydra's teeth, the children of the night!
[last lines]

For the moment, let them enjoy a calm sea, a fresh breeze and each other. The girl is pretty and I was always sentimental. But for Jason, there are other adventures. I have not finished with Jason. Let us continue the game another day.
The gods are best served by those who need their help the *least*.
Zeus, I was a sinner. I've never tried to deny it. But I didn't sin every day. Why then do you punish me *every day*?
Go ahead, Zeus. Throw down a thunderbolt, let the earth swallow me up. I defy you!
[Loud crash of thunder]
You can growl away all you like, Zeus. I mean what I say.
But tell me, what gods protect you?
None now.
You won't pass the Clashing Rocks.
If I had to punish *every* blasphemy, I would have *no followers*!
The gods want their entertainment.
Jason goes too far.
Because he speaks the truth when the gods themselves go too far?
If I meet a girl with a firm leg, a full bosom and a warm heart, let no man try and stop me.
We reach land at noon. Then you can fill your bellies until they grumble as much as your tongues.

[asked why the gods set temptations and traps for mortals]
So that the gods may know them, and men may know themselves.
Now the voyage is over, I don't want any trouble to begin
There won't be any trouble, Jason. Just tell us where the city is and when we attack.
We don't attack.
But that's foolish, you have the finest fighting men in the world.
40 fighting men against a nation?
Better forty than one Jason.
We're not *pirates*, Phalerus.
What's that girl done to you? We thought you were a fighting man.
I'm going up alone in the morning. See what the situation is.
Oh, you mean spy out the land. Well, why alone? Why not take a few of us scouting.
The fewer who go, the less can get caught. Now what's the fewest you can think of?
One, of course.
Right. I accept your advice.
Hera my dear, You really *must* learn to win without cheating... or to at least lose *gracefully*.
Pray to the gods, Jason!
The gods of Greece are cruel! In time, all men shall learn to live without them.
[first lines]
Well?

Zeus, king of the gods of the Greeks, brighten the ashes that I may read the future. I see... a great tree at the end of the world. And in its branches there hang the skull and skin of a ram. They gleam and shine for it is a prize of the gods, a Golden Fleece.
Envoys who come to me in deceit remain in death.
Aeetes, king of Colchis, awaits him in the temple of Hecate. And that is all *any* man shall say to him.
Rise up, you dead, slain of the hydra. Rise from your graves and avenge us. Those who steal the Golden Fleece must die.

[ordering his skeletal troops to action]
Destroy them... Kill... Kill! Kill! Kill them all!
PULL! Pull until your hearts crack and your backs break!
